Association des Femmes Kalgaal

description.narrative: This association has 70 orphans kids, most of them are either sick or need meds; the others dont have clothing or food to eat. They are planning to create a daycare center for poor families. Theyre giving opportunities for moms to find a job for a better life. This will have a high impact in an area where there is a need for children to receive quality education and parents to work. These benefits can translate into economic activity (no matter how small) for the city of Djibouti. The associations goal is to make these mothers self-sufficient so that they can provide for their families.

description.narrative: Sector: Economic Opportunity (self-help grant).This project will contribute in the fight against poverty by creating employment and increasing incomes for young men and women. In Djibouti, fish is more affordable for low income consumers and has a relatively lower price than meat (i.e. beef and chicken). The Association intends to create income generating activities through the purchase of fishnets. Theyll be fishing at the nearby Doudda beach and/or Loyaada beach.

description.narrative: Sector: Economic Opportunity (self-help grant) .The association would like to build a concrete wall around an already existing garden. At present, kids, camels, and other animals knock down the wall and get into the garden. The current earth wall also erodes when it rains and has to be rebuilt. The garden is perhaps a quarter of an acre, and would be enlarged slightly. There is also a water cistern that the association uses in order to have water for the garden.
